alert.note: Alert for Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued June 11 at 11:56PM MDT until June 13 at 10:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Crater Ridge Burn Area. * WHERE...Portions of south central Montana, including the following county, Big Horn. Portions of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Crater Ridge Burn Area is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and downstream of the Crater Ridge burn scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
